sectionText: Topic:  Intelligence and the Global Cold War Description:  This course examines the role played by state intelligence agencies in the Cold War (1945-1991).  While we will examine the role of the major Cold War powers like the United States and Soviet Union, particular attentiion will be given to various 'Third World' sites such as Africa where the Cold War played out in very 'hot' conflicts.  The key factors that we will examine are intelligence agencies and their personnel, who played leading roles in how the Cold War itself ws actually fought.
